column4: looks like a problem with the nginx source version, not with ubuntu
the Makefile has the option -Werror in the CFLAGS, which makes make fail on warnings, and the compiler emitted a warning
this is an issue with the version of nginx you used, or a bug in the compiler, and i lean towards the former
you should consider using the version of nginx that is packaged for ubuntu
yes , i also thought that , but i have google for a long time , and can't figure out the problem
the Makefile don't have the werror option
are you sure
yes http://paste.ubuntu.com/751148/
that is my Makefile
because i follow the tutorials which use that version
yes , i just want to complie it from the source
let me try the new version
i have found this http://www.serverphorums.com/read.php?5,308712 , but when i use that patch , it didn't work
and i also didn't know the what's the acutually reason that cause the problem
the actual reason is is right there in the error, a variable was defined but not used
the c compiler emitted a warning because of that, and because -Werror was in place, the compilation ended in error
so , i should find the -Werror option in the Makefile and delete it
that's the more immediate solution
the longer-term solution is to notify the nginx people about this issue so that they'll patch their code
i have find a patch , and it didn't work
i will report the bug to nginx
: thank you , i have solved it by change the nginx to version 1.0.10
